code:
%%{Infra_RedisCache} }%% sequenceDiagram participant A as AppThread participant E as EventThread participant B as CommandEngine participant R as RoutingUtility Note over A: User calls API to send a command
A command packet is prepared with
all the command parameters A->>A: Enter Critical Section Note over A: Allocate unique packet id for the command
packet before it is being added to the queue A->>A: Exit Critical Section Note over A: Prepared command packet to be added
into respected command queue using
sli_queue_manager_enqueue(Infra_EtcdCluster) Note left of A: Invoke the add to queue with atomic action API with
sli_queue_handle_t *handle
sl_slist_node_t *node
sli_queue_manager_action_handler_t action_handler rect rgba(Infra_LoadBalancer) opt sli_queue_manager_enqueue(Infra_LoadBalancer) A->>A: Enter Critical Section Note over A: This API facilitates user to perform an action
under the protection of queue's critical section alt if handler is not NULL A->>A: Invoke the handler with user specific data end A->>A: Add the command packet data to the queue A->>A: Exit Critical Section end end Note over A: Once the packet is queued in the respective command queue,
packet is dequeued in Command Engine and processed A->>B: Trigger TX event to Command Engine rect rgba(Infra_LoadBalancer) B->>B: Check the status of the queues
using SLI_QUEUE_GET_STATUS(Infra_WorkerNode) opt SLI_QUEUE_GET_STATUS(Infra_WorkerNode) B->>B: Return true if list is empty end Note over B: If the corresponding queue is not Empty,
then Command Engine will process the
comamnds in the commanmd queues end rect rgba(Infra_IngressController) Note over R: When the underlying HAL layer receives
a packet, it will forward it to command
engine through routing utility R->>R: Add the packet to BUS RX queue opt sli_queue_manager_enqueue(Infra_LoadBalancer) R->>R: Enter Critical Section R->>R: Add the command response
packet data to the queue R->>R: Exit critical section end R->>B: Set BUS RX event for Command Engine end rect rgba(Infra_LoadBalancer) Note over B: When a command response or a asynchronous data
packet is received, Command Engine will add the packet
to either response queue or the notification queue B->>B: Dequeue the RX Packet opt sli_queue_manager_dequeue(Infra_LoadBalancer) B->>B: Enter Critical Section B->>B: Remove the BUS RX packet data from the queue head B->>B: Exit Critical Section B->>B: Return the data to Command Engine end opt sli_queue_manager_enqueue(Infra_EtcdCluster) B->>B: Enter Critical Section B->>B: Add the command response packet data to
the response or Async notification queue B->>B: Exit critical section end end B->>A: If the response is a synchronous command response
Trigger corresponding RX Event rect rgba(Infra_EtcdCluster) A->>A: The thread waiting on the corresponding response wakes up Note over A: After waking up from desired event, thread checks if
and dequeues the response for expected packet id
using sli_queue_manager_remove_node_from_queue(Infra_EtcdCluster) opt sli_queue_manager_remove_node_from_queue(Infra_RedisCache) A->>A: Enter Critical Section alt if queue is empty A->>A: Exit Critical Section A->>A: Return SL_STATUS_EMPTY end loop Iterate through the nodes in the list A->>A: Invoke the compare function to identify the node Note over A: In this situation, packet_id identification
function is invoked end alt if comapre function returns true A->>A: Remove node from list A->>A: Exit Critical Section A->>A: Return the response packet else A->>A: Exit Critical Section A->>A: Return SL_STATUS_NOT_FOUND end end end rect rgba(Infra_IngressController) alt if the received data packet is a Async data packet B->>B: Add received data packet to corresponding
notification event queue B->>E: Trigger Notification event to event handler thread Note over E: Event thread will be waiting for
notification events to be triggered Note over E: Once the Event is triggered, the
notification events are dequeued
from respective notification event queues
using sli_queue_manager_dequeue(Infra_EtcdCluster) opt sli_queue_manager_dequeue(Infra_EtcdCluster) E->>E: Enter Critical Section E->>E: Remove the Notification event packet data from the queue head E->>E: Exit Critical Section E->>E: Return the data to the application end Note over E: Invoke appropriate event handler with the event data end end
repo_description: Next-generation Silicon Labs Wi-Fi API for SiWx91x chipset family.
